abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Second Rural Roads
            and Markets Improvement and Maintenance Project - Bangladesh
            were as follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, and the Bank and borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. The lessons indicate
            that (a) owing to expansion of the road network, the
            maintenance needs have grown by fifteen percent yearly and
            the shortfall is increasing, and that the Bank should
            explore with the government of Bangladesh additional means
            of funding of maintenance; (b) large-scale projects such as
            this, even though the Project is a follow-on project of a
            successful project, need a long time for preparation; (c)
            although the role of local governments has become
            increasingly important in managing rural infrastructure,
            their institutional capacity is very low and important
            efforts should be made to improve the capacity of the local
            government officials; (d) in future, adequate steps should
            be taken from the outset for (i) involvement of all
            stakeholders; (ii) effective information campaign; (iii)
            building a sense of ownership and commitment of the borrower
            in launching the program; and (iv) selection of reputable
            NGO/organization having proven track record in satisfactory
            implementation of this kind of activities; (e) the total
            number of contracts undertaken under the Project was
            overwhelmingly large; (f)  regular, intensive and effective
            supervision and monitoring are required to ensure that the
            intended environment management measures are integrated into
            planning/design and construction management of the
            sub-projects; (g) land acquisition procedures are outdated,
            time consuming and provides opportunities for corruption.
